thread.title: Arkansas returns to underdog role after offseason arrests
thread.title_full: Arkansas returns to underdog role after offseason arrests

title: Arkansas returns to underdog role after offseason arrests
text:
Arkansas returns to underdog role after offseason arrests Arkansas returns to underdog role in SEC after offseason arrests of 3 players POSTED: 05:35 PM CDT Oct 05, 2015 Tweet 
FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) â€” Arkansas coach Mike Anderson says he was "blindsided" by a tumultuous offseason for the Razorbacks, one that included the arrests of three players on allegations of using counterfeit money. 
Starting point guard Anton Beard, forward Jacorey Williams and transfer Dustin Thomas were arrested by Fayetteville police in July, accused of using counterfeit $20 bills and exchanging counterfeit $50 bills for $100 bills. 
Williams was dismissed from the Arkansas program in August, while Beard and Thomas have been suspended from the team and remain in school awaiting trial. 
The Razorbacks were 27-9 last season, reaching the NCAA Tournament for the first time since 2008.
